post.description: Import a previously created conversation into Dixa. For inbound messages the author is assumed to be the requester of the conversation (end user), unless the specific channel supports overriding the message author through its attributes. For outbound messages the author is specified using the agentId field.

requestBody.description: The type of conversation to import

Example1.description: The following example demonstrates how to import an email conversation. The key parts is the **genericChannelName** and the **attributes** fields. Please note that the **cc**, **bcc** and **requesterId** fields are optional. **cc** and **bcc** are only relevant for outbound messages, while **requesterId** message attribute is only relevant for inbound messages.

Example2.description: The following example demonstrates how to import a chat conversation. The key parts is the **genericChannelName** and the **attributes** fields. Please note that the **widgetId** is an optional field and could be omitted.

201.description: The id of the imported conversation

channel.description: values: [WhatsApp, Voicemail, WidgetChat, FacebookMessenger, Twitter, Email, ContactForm, Callback, PstnPhone, Sms, Messenger]

value.description: One of the the numeric values 0 and 1.
Token value. It will be added in the headers of the request as: 'Authorization': 'Bearer \<value\>'

queueId.description: The target queue for the conversation transfer

userId.description: An optional agent/admin to originate the transfer of the conversation

channel.description: values: [WhatsApp, Voicemail, WidgetChat, FacebookMessenger, Twitter, Email, ContactForm, Callback, PstnPhone, Sms, Messenger]

additionalEmails.description: Additional email addresses for the agent

additionalPhoneNumbers.description: Additional phone numbers for the agent

avatarUrl.description: The url from which to load the agent's avatar

items.description: values: [WhatsApp, Voicemail, WidgetChat, FacebookMessenger, Twitter, Email, ContactForm, Callback, PstnPhone, Sms, Messenger]

WebhookAuthorization.title: WebhookAuthorization
WebhookAuthorization.description: Authorization to be added as a header in the webhook request. Can be either, Basic auth, added as 'Basic base64encoded(\<username\>:\<password\>)', Token auth, added as 'Bearer \<token value\>', or no auth

subscribedEvents.description: The set of events this Webhook Subscription is subscribed to

items.description: values: [ConversationPending, AgentUnbannedEnduser, ConversationMessageAdded, ConversationTagAdded, AgentBannedIp, ConversationAssigned, ConversationPendingExpired, ConversationTransferred, ConversationEnqueued, ConversationCreated, ConversationUnassigned, ConversationOpen, ConversationAbandoned, ConversationClosed, ConversationNoteAdded, AgentBannedEnduser, ConversationEndUserReplaced, AgentUnbannedIp, ConversationTagRemoved, ConversationRated]

url.description: URL of the server that the webhook request should be sent to

secretKey.description: Dixa generated secret key, used to sign the requests

enabled.description: Defines whether this Webhook Subscription is enabled or disabled

createdAt.description: Date when this Webhook Subscription was created

createdBy.description: The ID of the user who created this Webhook Subscription

updatedAt.description: Date when this Webhook Subscription was last updated

updatedBy.description: The ID of the user who last updated this Webhook Subscription

filters.description: Filters to be applied to the events that are sent to this Webhook Subscription

Webhook_Headers_Map_String_String.title: Webhook_Headers_Map_String_String
Webhook_Headers_Map_String_String.description: The headers that will be added to the webhook request
